question.text: What are you feeling right now?
question.instruction: Choose the option that feels closest. You donâ€™t have to be precise.

answers.label: Shame
tips: Notice the feeling without judging it.
Allow the sensation to be present without trying to change it.
See if it softens when you stop resisting it.

answers.label: Guilt
tips: Let the feeling exist without explaining it.
Allow it to be there without pushing it away or acting on it.
Notice whether it releases on its own when you stop holding it.

answers.label: Fear
tips: Notice the fear as a sensation, not a story.
Allow it to be present without trying to feel safe or calm.
Observe if it changes when you no longer resist it.

answers.label: Anger
tips: Let the anger be there without suppressing or expressing it.
Allow the raw energy of it without blaming anyone.
See what happens when you stop trying to control it.

answers.label: Sadness
tips: Notice the heaviness or ache without labeling it as a problem.
Allow the feeling to exist without trying to cheer yourself up.
Let it move at its own pace without interference.

answers.label: Numbness / Nothing
tips: Notice the absence of sensation without forcing anything.
Allow the numbness to be there just as it is.
Sometimes allowing nothing is still allowing.

answers.label: Something Else
tips: Notice whatever sensation is most obvious right now.
Allow it without needing to name it clearly.
Let go of the need to get this right.
